page.title: 05ETWALL WELLDRESSINGS
page.content: A welldressing is a picture made with natural materials providing the colour. Before anything is done the boards are put in the lake to soak for a week. Then mums and dads and children come to puddle. This means mixing a bag of clay with a pound of salt and water in a tin bath. You walk up and down in bare feet until it is all mixed in. Then it is put on to the boards and spread evenly. A large paper pattern is placed on the clay and pricked out until the picture looks like a huge dot to dot. Aldercones and coffee beans are used to outline. Dry materials like fluor spar, wood and seeds are put in first.Last of all the individual petals are put in. This year our school well design was about protecting wildlife.
